column5: English
column11: English

column4: アリサ＿ＭＧを見てびっくり

column5:
Yo.
What'll it be today?
column11:
Yo.
What's it today?

column4:
何か新しいパーツが
入ってないかと思ってさ。
column5: We were wondering if you had any new parts in stock.
column11: We were wondering if you had any new parts in stock.

column4: アリサ＿ＭＧを見てびっくり

column5: Hm?
column11: Hm?

column4: この子、オヤジさんの子供？
column5: Is this kid yours, old man?
column11: Is this kid yours, old man?

column4:
なわけねぇだろ。
友人の娘さ。
column5:
Of course not.
She's the daughter of a friend.
column11:
Of course not.
She's the daughter of a friend.

column5: Figures.
column11: That figures.

column5: I'm Kay. Nice to meet you.
column11: I'm Kay. Nice to meet you.

column4: ひょっとして怖がってる？
column5: You're not afraid of me...are you?
column11: You're not afraid of me...are you?

column5: Am I scary?
column11: Am I scary?

column4:
すまねぇな。
怖いのは、お前じゃないんだ。
column5:
Sorry.
It's not that you're scary.
column11:
Sorry.
It's not that you're scary.

column4:
この子は
マリオネーションギアが
怖いんだよ。
column5: She's just afraid of Marionation Gear.
column11: This one is afraid of Marionation Gear.

column5: Huh!?
column11: Huh!?

column5: Why?
column11: Why?

column4:
マリオネーションギアは
文明の象徴だろ。
怖がる理由なんてないのに。
column5:
Marionation Gear are a symbol of our culture.
There's no reason to be scared.
column11:
Marionation Gear is a symbol of our culture.
There's no reason to be scared.

column4:
お前さんたちのいない間に、
ナイトシェイドが街はずれで
暴れ回ったのさ。
column5: While you were away, Nightshade went on a rampage on the edge of town.
column11: Whilst you lot were away, Night Shade went on a rampage on the edge of town.

column4:
その時、この子の両親は
大怪我してな。
column5: This girl's parents were both seriously injured.
column11: This girl's parents were both seriously injured.

column4:
この子は、その現場を
見ちまったんだ。
column5: She was there at the time and saw the whole thing.
column11: She was there at the time and saw the whole thing.

column4:
で、両親が入院している間、
わしがこの子をあずかってる
わけだ。
column5: So, I'm looking after her while her parents are in the hospital.
column11: So, whilst her parents are in hospital, I'm looking after her.
...Night Shade...

column5: ...Nightshade...

column4:
マリオネーションギアで
こんな子を苦しめるなんて……
column5: Using Marionation Gear to harm a young girl...
column11: Using Marionation Gear to harm a young girl...

column4: 俺はそういうの、許せねぇ。
column5: There's no way I can forgive that.
column11: There's no way I can forgive such a thing.

column4:
しかたねぇよ。
道具ってのは、使う人しだいだ。
column5:
There's nothing you can do.
The use of a tool depends on the user.
column11:
There's nothing you can do.
What you do with a tool depends on the person using it.

column4:
いいことに使うやつもいれば、
悪いことに使うやつもいる。
column5: There are people who'll use them for good, and others who'll do bad things.
column11: There are people who'll use them for good, and others who'll do bad things.

column4:
そうだけど……
マリオネーションギアは……
column5:
Even so...
Marionation Gear are...
column11:
Even so...
Marionation Gear is...

column4:
マリオネーションギアは
ただの道具じゃないんだ。
column5: Marionation Gear aren't just tools.
column11: Marionation Gear is not just a tool.

column4:
１つ１つ手作りで……
作り手の魂が宿ってる。
column5:
Handmade, piece by piece...
They capture the soul of their creator.
column11:
Handmade, piece by piece...
They capture the soul of their creator.

column4:
あいつらは、工場で量産された
人形を使ってるから、
それがわからないんだ。
column5: Those people mass-producing Puppets in a factory -- they don't understand that.
column11: Those people mass producing mechs in a factory, they don't understand that.

column5: ...You might be right.
column11: ...You might be right.

column4:
ところで、頼みたいことが
あるんだ。
column5: By the way, I have a favor to ask.
column11: By the way, I have a favour to ask.

column4:
そんなことがあったせいで、
病院で薬が不足してる。
column5: After what happened, the hospital is short on supplies.
column11: After what happened, the hospital are short on supplies.

column4:
薬を積んだ/c5輸送車/c3が
こっちへ向かってるんだが、
ついさっき連絡が入った。
column5: There was a /c5transport truck/c3 loaded with medicine heading our way, but they just got in touch.
column11: There was a /c5transport truck/c3 loaded with medicine heading our way, but they've just been in touch.

column4:
どうやら、道がわからなくて、
困ってるらしい。
column5: Apparently, they've gotten a little lost.
column11: It seems they've gotten a little lost.

column4:
薬は一刻をあらそう。
すまんが、輸送車をここまで
誘導してくれるか？
column5: The medicine is going to go to waste. I hate to ask, but could you guide the transport truck here?
column11: The medicine is going to waste. I hate to ask, but could you guide the transport truck here?

column5:
All right!
Leave it to us!
column11:
All right!
Leave it to us!

column5: You don't mind, right, /p?
column11: You don't mind, right /p?

column4:
輸送車に近づくと、
向こうから寄ってくる。
うまくここまで誘導してくれ。
column5: When you're getting close to the truck, approach in the lead and it will follow. Just guide it over here.
column11: When you're getting close to the truck, approach in the lead and it will follow. Nimbly guide it in this direction.

column4: アリサ＿ＭＧを見てびっくり
